newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SAX index eases on mixed blue chips.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SAX index eases on mixed blue chips.

text.p: Major Slovak shares closed mixed in quiet activity on the Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE) on Wednesday, pulling the SAX index down 1.54 points to 205.90.
Brokers said the thin volume of trading on Wednesday resulted from a general slowdown on neighbouring markets.

"I think our market is finaly reacting to the situation in this region, with delay showing that it has been at the tail-end of the main central and east European markets," Dusan Sykora of ING Barings said.
Steel maker VSZ closed 15 crowns higher at 715 on 3,078 shares traded, but Sykora said he expected the issue's price to flatten out soon.
"A strong demand (for VSZ) appeared at 700 during the session, urging somebody to buy even at 715, but I think the price will return to some 705 later this week," he said.
Oil refiner Slovnaft remained unchanged at its nominal value of 1,000 crowns, seen as the cheapest refinery issue in the region, but the issue on Wednesday traded only 99 shares.
Overall volume eased to 254,837 shares, from 385,405 shares traded on Tuesday, while turnover rose to 210.27 million crowns, from 136.91 million.
